intro: Nerium coraea, commonly known as the coastal hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to coastal regions of southern Africa. It is characterized by its woody stems and large, showy flowers that range in color from white to pink and red. The plant thrives in saline and sandy soils, making it well adapted to coastal environments. Its leaves are typically lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers have five petals and a distinctive central stamen. Nerium coraea is often used in coastal landscaping due to its hardiness and ornamental value.
